intro: Jardinea gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in savanna and woodland areas, where it thrives in full sun. Jardinea gabonensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant.
